summary: This is a calendar entry for a 15-minute conference call scheduled on September 27, 2007, organized by Alex Acosta regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The entry shows Acosta, then U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, scheduling a call about Epstein, indicating high-level DOJ attention to the case at that time.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida (USAFLS), Organizer
persons.context: Organized a 15-minute conference call regarding Jeffrey Epstein, scheduled from his office on September 27, 2007.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, was organizing a conference call regarding Epstein, indicating he was overseeing or involved in the federal investigation/prosecution of Epstein.

events.title: Conference Call Regarding Epstein
events.description: A 15-minute conference call was scheduled by U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta from his office to discuss Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta scheduled a conference call specifically about Jeffrey Epstein on September 27, 2007.
The call was scheduled for 15 minutes (7:45 PM to 8:00 PM), indicating it was a brief, focused discussion among officials.
The calendar entry was created in 2007 and later modified in November 2010, suggesting ongoing relevance or review of the event.
The entry shows high-level DOJ attention to the Epstein case during the initial investigation period in 2007.
